entity1.name: esports
entity1.description: A form of competitive sports where video games are played by professional gamers, often in organized competitions with significant prize pools and sponsorships.;;;The sector of the entertainment business dedicated to the creation, distribution, and monetization of video games.;;;A form of competitive sports using video games, often organized with professional players and large audiences.;;;Professional athletes who compete in organized video gaming competitions.;;;A form of competitive gaming that involves professional players competing in various video games, typically for prize money and recognition, and watched by large audiences online or in person.;;;The sector of the entertainment industry that encompasses the development, distribution, and monetization of video games.;;;Competitive multiplayer video gaming as an organized, professional activity, often involving tournaments and leagues with significant viewership and prize pools.;;;A form of competitive multiplayer video gaming, often organized into structured leagues and tournaments with professional players and significant viewership.;;;The practice of playing video games in a highly competitive environment, often with organized tournaments and leagues.;;;A form of competitive sports where the primary aspects of the sport are facilitated by electronic systems; most commonly video games.;;;A form of video game playing where players compete against each other in organized events or tournaments, often with significant prizes and audiences.;;;A form of competitive sports using video games, often organized with professional players and significant audiences.;;;The practice of playing video games in a competitive environment, often involving high-level skills and strategies.;;;A competitive video gaming industry where professional players compete in organized, multiplayer video game competitions.;;;Competitive video gaming, often organized in leagues or tournaments with professional players and significant audiences.;;;Competitive video gaming competitions that attract large audiences.;;;The practice of playing video games in a highly competitive environment, often with the goal of winning tournaments and prizes.;;;A form of competitive sports where video games are played by professional gamers, often in organized, multiplayer competitions.;;;A competitive form of video gaming that has gained significant popularity and recognition as a professional sport.

entity38.name: Virtual reality
entity38.description: A computer-generated simulation of a three-dimensional image or environment that can be interacted with in a seemingly real or physical way by a person using special electronic equipment, such as a helmet with a screen inside or gloves fitted with sensors.

entity39.name: Augmented reality
